pr_title: Used Dialog Fragment to create Remove Group Dialog

timeline.bodyText: This should be deleteRepeat because it does not apply to general groups.
timeline.author: lognaturel

replies.bodyText: By the way, the delete_repeat string resource and other related ones are super confusing because they use the word "Group". I think we should change that but it's a separate thing.
replies.author: lognaturel

timeline.bodyText: I'm not loving this protected field pattern for testing and I see it shows up in #3792 as well. I think that again, using a ViewModel here would help address that.
timeline.author: lognaturel

replies.bodyText: I also feel now implementing a ViewModel would be better. I will do that.
replies.author: SaumiaSinghal

timeline.bodyText:
I don't think this works because the ViewModel will have a reference to the Activity, causing a leak.
I thought the callbacks you had before were fine. I was imagining the ViewModel only as a way for the dialog to get access to the FormController. Even better might be to give access only to the data that the dialog needs which I think is the last deleted repeat name and the last deleted repeat index.
timeline.author: lognaturel

replies.bodyText: Sorry @ln I didn't realize this would cause activity leak.
replies.author: SaumiaSinghal

timeline.message: create getLastRepeatedGroupName() and getLastRepeatedGroupRepeatCount() in formEntryViewModel

timeline.bodyText: @lognaturel I changed the tests a little bit so as to avoid using protected scope for callback. I like this approach better than directly approaching the interface in the fragment.
timeline.author: SaumiaSinghal

timeline.message: created Alert Dialog in DeleteRepeatDailog fragment
add unit test to check the activity implemts dialog callback interface
